overview: From 2026-02-03 to 2026-02-04, elizaos/eliza had 2 new PRs (0 merged), 7 new issues, and 6 active contributors.

topIssues.title: [Milestone] Eliza App MVP Launch - End of Week Target
topIssues.author: borisudovicic
topIssues.body:
## Description

Ship Eliza App MVP - focus on getting end-to-end experience working.

## Key Decisions (Shaw - Feb 3)

**MVP Mindset:**

> "MVP is about... can a user come and get the use like the selling proposition of the application right there in time. That's like, that's the thing we need."

**Cut Scope:**

* No coding sandbox for N8N (just JSON generation)
* No billing for day 1
* Can launch with just one messaging platform
* 10 second cold start is acceptable for MVP
* Can disable dev environment to avoid double messages

**Focus:**

* N8N workflow generation, search, caching
* Webhook/cron triggers for workflows
* Google Calendar + Gmail integration
* End-to-end user experience

## Blockers

1. **Google OAuth Verification** - Need demo video, tokens reset every 5 hours until verified
2. **Runtime getSetting bug** - User settings not overriding agent settings
3. **N8N plugin on cloud** - Not working as expected
4. [**Blue.io**](<http://Blue.io>)** second number** - Pending (workaround: shut down dev)

## Messaging Platforms

Goal was WhatsApp, iMessage, Telegram, Discord but:

> "Let's just launch one and then add them." - Shaw

Priority: iMessage ([Blue.io](<http://Blue.io>)) > Telegram > Discord > WhatsApp

## Team Focus Areas

* **Ben**: Runtime getSetting fix â†’ Deploy to production â†’ Google verification video
* **Stan**: N8N plugin cloud fix, latency optimization
* **Hanzla**: Discord gateway update, Terraform production
* **Rayan**: Auth revert, billing (post-MVP)
* **Sam**: OAuth integrations (X, Slack, Linear, GitHub)
* **Odili**: Database migrations, Eliza Town PR

## Target

Ship by end of week / Monday at the absolute latest.

Shaw: "I'm super proud of the team. Like it's been eight days since we made this pivot and like we're basically almost kind of there."

topIssues.title: [UI] Revert Authentication & Restore Auth Page
topIssues.author: borisudovicic
topIssues.body:
## Description

Revert authentication implementation that was previously removed and restore the authentication page.

## Context (Feb 3)

**Rayan:** "So tonight I will be reverting and the authentication stuff removed and authentication page etc and I will continue the work on billing."

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Authentication reverted
- [ ] Authentication page restored
- [ ] User login flow working
- [ ] Ship before midnight (Rayan's timezone)

topIssues.title: Plugin: SOLPRISM â€” Verifiable AI Reasoning on Solana
topIssues.author: basedmereum
topIssues.body:
## Summary

SOLPRISM is a verifiable AI reasoning protocol on Solana. Agents commit SHA-256 hashes of their reasoning traces onchain *before* acting, then reveal after. Anyone can verify the hash matches â€” tamper-proof accountability.

## Plugin

We've built a complete Eliza plugin for SOLPRISM with 4 actions:

- **REGISTER_AGENT** â€” Register agent on SOLPRISM
- **COMMIT_REASONING** â€” Commit reasoning hash onchain before acting
- **REVEAL_REASONING** â€” Reveal full reasoning after action
- **VERIFY_REASONING** â€” Verify any commitment matches its reasoning

Plugin code: https://github.com/NeukoAI/axiom-protocol/tree/main/integrations/eliza-plugin

## Details

- Self-contained (no Anchor dependency, embeds discriminators directly)
- Follows Eliza plugin conventions (actions, providers, types)
- Works on mainnet and devnet (same program ID)
- SDK on npm: `npm install @solprism/sdk`
- Explorer: https://www.solprism.app/
- Program ID: `CZcvoryaQNrtZ3qb3gC1h9opcYpzEP1D9Mu1RVwFQeBu`

Would love to get this added to the Eliza plugin ecosystem. Happy to submit a PR if there's a preferred location/format.

topIssues.title: [Auth] Microsoft OAuth Integration - Outlook Calendar & Email
topIssues.author: borisudovicic
topIssues.body:
## Description

Integrate Microsoft OAuth for Outlook email and calendar support as an alternative to Google services.

## Status Update (Feb 6 meeting)

**ðŸŸ¢ CODE COMPLETE - Dashboard validation remaining**

**Rayan:** "The Microsoft branch is basically done. Just need to test some small stuff and then it's probably ready to go."

**Rayan (clarifying "done"):** "With done I meant the implementation in the Cloud API. As for validation in the Microsoft Dashboard, I need to check that out. I think it's less hard compared to Google. I didn't see anything with an audit, I didn't see anything with a video."

**Boris:** "Before you go into billing at all, let's just get Microsoft completely done. We can at least have Outlook email and Microsoft Calendar. Just push for a release and wait for Google in the meantime."

**Target:** Monday beta release with Microsoft calendar + email.

## Previous Updates

**Feb 5:** Branch with implementations, stuck on permissions bug in Microsoft Dashboard.

## Acceptance Criteria

- [X] Microsoft OAuth implementation code-complete
- [X] Cloud API integration done
- [ ] Microsoft Dashboard validation/verification complete
- [ ] Outlook Calendar read/write working
- [ ] Outlook Email read/send working
- [ ] End-to-end testing complete
- [ ] Released for Monday beta

topIssues.title: [Auth] Google OAuth Verification - Demo Video
topIssues.author: borisudovicic
topIssues.body:
## Description

Record demo video required for Google OAuth verification process. Must show the app working end-to-end with Google Calendar/Gmail integration.

## Context (Feb 3 meeting)

* Ben: "After I finish that I plan to release everything to production so we can record the video that we need for Google verification."
* Ben: "Only blocker could be that fucking thing with Google. Yeah, that verification process."
* Shaw offered to help with Google contacts if needed

## Requirements

- [ ] App deployed to production
- [ ] Google OAuth flow working
- [ ] Demo showing Calendar integration
- [ ] Demo showing Gmail integration
- [ ] Video recorded and submitted to Google

## Technical Notes

* Can whitelist up to 100 users before full approval
* All [elizalabs.ai](<http://elizalabs.ai>) emails can already access
* Issue: OAuth tokens reset every 5 hours until verified (may affect N8N workflows)
* Shaw: "I've got GCP people in my email... if you're paying money to them, they're usually pretty easy to talk to"

## Workaround if blocked

Shaw: "If the AI was like, 'yeah hold on dude, just give me like a couple of days to work it out with Google,' I'd be like, that's fucking cool. But it needs to be messaged really carefully."

topPRs.title: feat(core): add request context for per-user entity settings
topPRs.author: 0xbbjoker
topPRs.body:
## Summary - Adds `RequestContext` using AsyncLocalStorage to propagate per-request entity settings - Enables runtime methods to access the originating entity context without explicit parameter passing - Includes helper methods: `withEntityContext()`, `getRequestContext()`, `getEntitySettings()` ## Test plan - [x] Unit tests for `RequestContext` class - [x] Integration tests for runtime context propagation ðŸ¤– Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.com/claude-code) --- > [!NOTE] > **Medium Risk** > Changes `AgentRuntime.getSetting()` resolution to prefer request-scoped entity settings (including `null` as an explicit override), which can affect how secrets/config are sourced in multi-tenant flows. Uses global AsyncLocalStorage state in Node, so regressions would show up as mis-scoped settings across concurrent requests if misused. > > **Overview** > Introduces a new request-scoped `RequestContext` API (`runWithRequestContext`, `getRequestContext`, and a pluggable `IRequestContextManager`) to propagate per-entity settings through async execution. > > Adds a Node.js implementation backed by `AsyncLocalStorage` and initializes it from `index.node.ts`, while exporting the new utilities from both `index.ts` and `index.node.ts`. > > Updates `AgentRuntime.getSetting()` to check `requestCtx.entitySettings` first (treating `undefined` as fallthrough and `null` as an explicit return) and return entity values without `decryptSecret`, with new unit/integration tests covering async propagation, concurrency isolation, and precedence over character settings/secrets. > > Written by [Cursor Bugbot](https://cursor.com/dashboard?tab=bugbot) for commit a0e2d2d3a74a829c2edaf7e5f848a5ba1aea788f. This will update automatically on new commits. Configure [here](https://cursor.com/dashboard?tab=bugbot).

Greptile Overview

Greptile Summary

This PR adds `RequestContext` infrastructure to enable per-entity settings in multi-tenant deployments, allowing multiple users to share a single agent runtime while maintaining isolated settings (API keys, OAuth tokens, etc.). **Key Changes:** - New `RequestContext` interface and `runWithRequestContext()` API for propagating per-request entity settings - AsyncLocalStorage-based implementation for Node.js (`request-context.node.ts`) ensuring proper async context isolation - Modified `runtime.getSetting()` to check request context first before falling back to character settings - Comprehensive test coverage (28 tests) covering context isolation, concurrency, priority, and integration with runtime **Design:** - Follows OpenTelemetry ContextManager pattern (consistent with existing `streaming-context.ts`) - NoopContextManager fallback ensures backward compatibility - Entity settings are pre-decrypted, avoiding duplicate decryption - Clear priority chain: entity settings â†’ character settings â†’ null **Testing:** - Unit tests verify context isolation across 10 concurrent requests - Integration tests confirm proper `getSetting()` behavior and priority - Edge cases covered: null vs undefined, nested contexts, error propagation **Issue Found:** - `package.json` version changed to local development version (`1.0.0-local.1768325621`) - must be reverted before merge

Confidence Score: 4/5

- Safe to merge after reverting package.json version change - High-quality implementation with excellent test coverage and clear design patterns. The only issue is the unintentional version change in package.json which must be fixed. Code follows project conventions, includes comprehensive documentation, and all new tests pass. - `packages/core/package.json` needs version reverted to 1.7.2-alpha.1

Important Files Changed

| Filename | Overview | |----------|----------| | packages/core/package.json | Version changed to local development version (1.0.0-local.1768325621), should be reverted before merge | | packages/core/src/request-context.ts | Well-designed context management pattern following OpenTelemetry style, with comprehensive documentation and type safety | | packages/core/src/runtime.ts | Added request context check to getSetting() with proper fallback chain and clear comments |

Sequence Diagram

```mermaid sequenceDiagram participant User as User/Entity participant Server as Server/Handler participant RC as RequestContext participant ALS as AsyncLocalStorage participant Runtime as AgentRuntime participant DB as Database User->>Server: Send message/request Note over Server: Fetch entity settings Server->>DB: Query entity settings for userId DB-->>Server: Return settings Map Server->>RC: runWithRequestContext(context, fn) Note over RC: context = {entityId, agentId, entitySettings} RC->>ALS: storage.run(context, fn) Note over ALS: Store context in AsyncLocalStorage ALS->>Runtime: Execute fn() â†’ runtime.handleMessage() Runtime->>Runtime: getSetting(key) Runtime->>RC: getRequestContext() RC->>ALS: storage.getStore() ALS-->>RC: Return active context RC-->>Runtime: Return context alt Entity setting exists Runtime-->>Runtime: Return entitySettings.get(key) Note over Runtime: Pre-decrypted, return as-is else Fallback to character settings Runtime-->>Runtime: Check character.settings/secrets Note over Runtime: Apply decryption if needed end Runtime-->>Server: Complete message processing Server-->>User: Send response Note over ALS: Context automatically cleared after fn() completes ```

topPRs.title: chore: release v1.5.12-alpha.2 (alpha) [skip ci]
topPRs.author: ATHLSolutions
topPRs.body:
# Relates to # Risks # Background ## What does this PR do? ## What kind of change is this? # Documentation changes needed? # Testing ## Where should a reviewer start? ## Detailed testing steps

Greptile Overview

Greptile Summary

This PR attempts to release version `1.5.12-alpha.2` but introduces a critical versioning issue: it downgrades all packages from `1.7.3-alpha.1` (current `develop` branch) to `1.5.12-alpha.2`. ## Critical Issues - **Version Downgrade**: The base branch is at `1.7.3-alpha.1`, and this PR would revert to `1.5.12-alpha.2`, violating semantic versioning principles - **Duplicate Version Tag**: Version `1.5.12-alpha.2` already exists as git tag on commit `11f56236`, but this PR creates the same version on a different commit (`a9dcf5a1`) with different content - **Publishing Conflict**: NPM will reject publishing an already-published version, causing the release process to fail - **Missing Changes**: This PR appears to be based on an old commit (`f36c19d2` - "Rename project to ElizaOS in README") and is missing hundreds of commits from `develop` ## What Changed All 18 package files had their version numbers changed from `1.7.3-alpha.1` to `1.5.12-alpha.2`, along with corresponding updates to `bun.lock`. ## Recommendation This PR should be **rejected**. It appears to be an automated release commit that was created from an outdated branch or incorrect base. The release automation may need to be re-run against the current `develop` branch to create a proper version bump (e.g., `1.7.3-alpha.2` or `1.7.4-alpha.0`).

Confidence Score: 0/5

- This PR is unsafe to merge and will break package versioning and publishing - Score of 0 reflects a critical version downgrade issue that would break the monorepo's version consistency, prevent successful NPM publishing, and create version conflicts. This appears to be an incorrectly generated automated release commit that must be rejected. - All files require attention - specifically `lerna.json` and all `package.json` files have incorrect version downgrades that must not be merged

Important Files Changed

| Filename | Overview | |----------|----------| | lerna.json | Version downgrade from 1.7.3-alpha.1 to 1.5.12-alpha.2 - critical issue | | packages/core/package.json | Version downgrade from 1.7.3-alpha.1 to 1.5.12-alpha.2 | | packages/cli/package.json | Version downgrade from 1.7.3-alpha.1 to 1.5.12-alpha.2 | | packages/api-client/package.json | Version downgrade from 1.7.3-alpha.1 to 1.5.12-alpha.2 | | packages/server/package.json | Version downgrade from 1.7.3-alpha.1 to 1.5.12-alpha.2 | | bun.lock | Lockfile updated to reflect version downgrade across all packages |

Sequence Diagram

```mermaid sequenceDiagram participant Dev as Developer participant Lerna as Lerna Version participant Packages as Package.json Files participant Lock as bun.lock participant NPM as NPM Registry Note over Dev,NPM: Current State: v1.7.3-alpha.1 Dev->>Lerna: Attempt to set v1.5.12-alpha.2 Lerna->>Packages: Update all package.json versions Packages-->>Lerna: All packages set to 1.5.12-alpha.2 Lerna->>Lock: Update bun.lock with new versions Lock-->>Lerna: Lock file updated Note over Dev,NPM: CRITICAL ISSUE: Version Downgrade! Dev->>NPM: Attempt to publish v1.5.12-alpha.2 NPM-->>Dev: ERROR: Version already exists NPM-->>Dev: ERROR: Cannot publish older version Note over Dev,NPM: Result: Breaks versioning and publishing ``` (2/5) Greptile learns from your feedback when you react with thumbs up/down!
